page.title: 03The Cromwell Museum
page.content: From 1160_1547 the museum was part of the St John the Baptists hospital it was never disolved and in 1565 became the town grammar school.It remained so until the second world war. One of the pupils was Oliver Cromwell. In 1962 it became a museum and traces the history of the Cromwell family and the civil war. There is a fine collection of family portraits and other paintings and prints give us detail of events, places and things. The three albums in the museum describe the major happenings of the civil war including a desciption of the kings trial. The case also represents items associated with the Cromwell family and the civil war.The life size model of a Pikeman and a Musketeer are well worth the visit alone.
